Properties of all dependencies

Properties of entitlements-service

#
# Max number of attempts for concurrent update
#
entitlement.update.attempts=5

#
# Max delay between the attempts, ms
# The delay is intended to spare concurrent requests in time
# and varies randomly from 0 to the offset.
#
entitlement.update.offset=30

kernel.applicationArtifactId=com.hybris.entitlements

kernel.applicationGroupId=entitlements

kernel.applicationVersion=5.6.0.0

Properties of jdbc-engine

##################### JDBC #####################################################
#
# Fully qualified name of the JDBC data source class used by the driver of the database
#
# @highlight
dataSource.className=org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCDataSource

#
# JDBC connection URL
#
# @highlight
dataSource.jdbcUrl=jdbc:hsqldb:mem:testDB

#
# Username to use for connection
#
# @highlight
dataSource.username=sa

#
# Password to use for connection
#
# @highlight
dataSource.password=

#
# JNDI name of data source
#
dataSource.jndiName=

#
# Maximum number of connections that will be contained in every partition
#
dataSource.maxConnections=36

#
# Minimum number of connections that will be contained in every partition
#
dataSource.minConnections=16

#
# Sets the maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait before a call to getConnection is timed out.
# Setting this to zero is similar to setting it to Long.MAX_VALUE Default: 0 ( = wait forever )
#
dataSource.connectionTimeoutInMs=5000

#
# Sets default auto commit mode
#
dataSource.defaultAutoCommit=true

# This sets the time (in seconds), for a connection to remain idle before sending
# a test query to the DB. This is useful to prevent a DB from timing out connections
# on its end. Do not use aggressive values here!
dataSource.idleConnectionTestPeriodInSeconds=14400

# The time (in seconds), for a connection to remain unused before it is closed off. Do not use aggressive values here!
# Default: 60 minutes, set to 0 to disable.
dataSource.idleMaxAgeInSeconds=3600

# Sets statementsCacheSize setting.
# The number of statements to cache.
dataSource.statementsCacheSize=0

# Useful when your application is doing lots of work on each connection
# (i.e. perform an SQL query, do lots of non-DB stuff and perform another query),
# otherwise will probably slow things down.
dataSource.releaseHelperThreads=3

# Sets number of statement helper threads to create that will handle releasing a statement.
# When this value is set to zero, the application thread is blocked until the pool and JDBC driver are able to close off the statement.
# When a non-zero value is set, the pool will create threads that will take care of closing off the statement asychronously to the application via the release helper
# threads).
# Useful when your application is opening up lots of statements otherwise will probably slow things down.
dataSource.statementReleaseHelperThreads=0

# When the available connections are about to run out, BoneCP will dynamically create new ones in batches.
# This property controls how many new connections to create in one go (up to a maximum of maxConnectionsPerPartition).
# Note: This is a per partition setting.
dataSource.acquireIncrement=5

# In order to reduce lock contention and thus improve performance,
# each incoming connection request picks off a connection from a pool that has thread-affinity,
# i.e. pool[threadId % partition_count]. The higher this number, the better your performance will be for the case
# when you have plenty of short-lived threads. Beyond a certain threshold, maintenance of these pools will start
# to have a negative effect on performance (and only for the case when connections on a partition start running out).
dataSource.partitionCount=3

#
# Name used for the connection pool used by kernel.
# This name is handed to the underlying Hikari connection pool and used for logging and JMX export
#
connectionPool.name=kernel

#
# Enables the Export of MBeans for the HikariCP this is required for JMX monitoring.
#
connectionPool.registerMbeans=true

#
# Enables/disables collecting update statements and params which are then executed in a batch statement during update (true/false)
#
kernel.jdbc.batch.disabled=false

#
# Number of batched updates to accumulate before real execution (Oracle database only)
#
kernel.jdbc.batch.oracle.batchSize=50

#
# Number of rows that should be fetched (0 means default driver properties)
#
kernel.jdbc.fetchSize=0

#
# Maximum number of rows that will be fetched (0 means there is no limit)
#
kernel.jdbc.maxRows=0

#
# Optional. Schema name used to create objects. If left empty kernel will try to determine database schema automatically.
# If set to "null" no schema will be provided to the queries.
#
kernel.jdbc.schemaName=

#
# type:size of shemalesss attribute value column. Use any type from java.sql.Types
#
kernel.jdbc.schemalessAttributeType=VARCHAR:255

#
# delimitedIdentifierMode: overrides the default behaviour of platform-specific delimited identifier mode (e.g. double quotes around db entities)
# could accept values AUTO, true and false
#
kernel.jdbc.platform.delimitedIdentifierMode=AUTO

Properties of mongodb-engine

##################### MongoDB ##################################################
#
# MongoDB connection URL
# See: http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/connection-string/
# Replica Set seed servers URL example: mongodb://localhost:27017,localhost:27018,localhost:27019
# Authentication enabled server URL example: mongodb://user:password@localhost:27017/dbName?authMechanism=MONGODB-CR
# @highlight
persistence.engine.mongodb.url=mongodb://localhost:27017

#
# Database name
#
# @highlight
persistence.engine.mongodb.databaseName=_CHANGE_ME_

# Mongo options see http://http://api.mongodb.org/java/current/com/mongodb/MongoOptions.html
persistence.engine.mongodb.option.autoConnectRetry=false

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.connectionsPerHost=10

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.connectTimeout=5000

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.description=MongoDBConnection

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.maxAutoConnectRetryTime=0

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.maxWaitTime=120000

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.safe=false

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.socketKeepAlive=false

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.socketTimeout=5000

persistence.engine.mongodb.schemalessMetadataCollectionName=schemaless_metadata

persistence.engine.mongodb.retry.count=7

persistence.engine.mongodb.retry.wait=1000

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.writeConcern=NORMAL

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.alwaysUseMBeans=false

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.threadsAllowedToBlockForConnectionMultiplier=5

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.cursorFinalizerEnabled=true

persistence.engine.mongodb.option.readPreference=primaryPreferred

Properties of hybris-commons-monitoring

# JMX Bean registration strategy. Possible values:
# FAIL_ON_EXISTING
# IGNORE_EXISTING
# REPLACE_EXISTING
#
hybris.commons.jmx.registrationBehaviorName=FAIL_ON_EXISTING

# Enables/disables use of AppVersionProvider to create domain name for JMX MBeans
#
hybris.commons.jmx.useAppVersionProvider=true

#
# Default name of JMX domain for beans exposed by commons jmx module
#
hybris.commons.jmx.defaultDomain=com.hybris

#
# Name of System Properties MBean
#
hybris.commons.jmx.systemPropertiesMBean.name=System Properties

#
# Expose CollectJvmMetrics
#
hybris.commons.collect.jvm.metric=true

Properties of hybris-commons-tenant

#
# Name of tenant which will be used as the 'single' tenant
# in case kernel.singleTenantMode=true, otherwise property has no effect
#
# @highlight
kernel.defaultTenant=single

#
# Enables/Disables single tenant context, so always the
# tenant configured by kernel.defaultTenant is active in context
#
# @highlight
kernel.singleTenantMode=true

Properties of init-app

##################### Init-App ##############################################
#
# Defines application name used to register Init App REST resource in service registry
# initapp.application.name=
# Enables/disables InitApp
#
# @highlight
kernel.initapp.enabled=true

#
# Enables/disables system initialization option in Init-App
#
kernel.initapp.systemInitializationEnabled=true

#
# If set to non-empty value enables security
#
# @highlight
kernel.initapp.securityKey=

#
# Thread pool size for asynchronous operations
#
kernel.initapp.taskExecutor.poolSize=1

Properties of kernel-persistence

##################### Persistence ##############################################
#
# Enables/Disables validation if managed objects with unique attributes
# or indexes are associated with persistence engine which supports uniqueness
# (true/false)
#
initialization.validateUniqueSupported=true

#
# Enables/Disables validation if managed objects with geospatial indexes are associated
# with persistence engine which supports geospatial
# (true/false)
#
initialization.validateGeoSupported=true

#
# Defines how system should be initialized
# Possible values:
# - ignore : (recommended) No check during startup. Use init-app to initialize/update system
# - create : Will initialize system if not initialized or fail when not up to date.
# - update : Will initialize system if not initialized or update when not up to date.
# - create-drop : Will drop schema (and ALL DATA) and then initialize system from scratch again.
#
# @highlight
kernel.autoInitMode=create

#
# Regular expression path to project data. Separate different paths by ','
#
kernel.projectDataPath=/META-INF/project-data-*

#
# Regular expression path to essential data. Separate different paths by ','
#
kernel.essentialDataPath=/META-INF/essential-data-*,/META-INF/initial-data-*

#
# Maximum pool size of task executor
#
kernel.taskExecutor.maxPoolSize=4

#
# Initial pool size of task executor
#
kernel.taskExecutor.corePoolSize=4

#
# Maximum time in milliseconds for kernel event listener to process the message.
# After this time processing is canceled and exception is logged.
#
kernel.eventProcessingTimeout=30000

#
# Cache synchronization mode during initial data import
# Possible values: AFTER_IMPORT_CHUNK, AFTER_IMPORT, NONE - see ImportCacheSynchMode enum
#
kernel.importCacheSyncMode=AFTER_IMPORT_CHUNK

#
# Enables/Disables clearing cache after deleting tenant (true/false)
#
kernel.clearCacheAfterDeletingTenant=true

#
# Batch size during importing initial data
#
kernel.importBatchSize=1000

#
# csv serialization and deserialization by default doesn't work with empty strings(instead, null values will be used).
# if csv.emptyStringDefault.active is true, then csv.emptyString value will represent the empty string.
#
csv.emptyStringDefault.active=false

#
# Value which represents empty string
#
csv.emptyString=

#
# Supported locale during import and export
#
csv.locales=de,fr,en,pl,it,zh,ja

#
# JGroups channel configuration
# Possible values:
# disable, skip - skips configuration
# enable, default - default configuration
# - see jgroups documentation
#
kernel.events.cluster.jgroups.channel=jgroups-protocol.xml

kernel.jgroups.udp.mcast_addr=224.0.0.252

kernel.jgroups.udp.mcast_port=45588

#
# Pattern used to validate names of tenants during tenant creation process.
# If this pattern is empty no validation will be done.
#
kernel.tenantNameRegexPattern=[a-zA-Z_0-9]{1,10}

#
# Pattern use to scan for files with metadata information for schema-less attributes
#
kernel.propertyMetadataReader.fileNamePattern=/META-INF/schemaless-metadata.properties

#
# default stream import settings
#
kernel.import.incremental=false

Properties of kernel-cache

##################### Cache ####################################################
#
# Enables/Disables kernel cache (true/false)
#
# @highlight
kernel.cacheEnabled=true

#
# Enables/Disables distributed cache (true/false)
#
# @highlight
kernel.distributedCache=false

# EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
# kernel.ehcache.peerProviderFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheManagerPeerProviderFactory
kernel.ehcache.peerProviderFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.jgroups.JGroupsCacheManagerPeerProviderFactory

# EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.peerProviderFactoryProperties=peerDiscovery=automatic,\
multicastGroupAddress=230.0.0.1,\
multicastGroupPort=4446,\
timeToLive=16

timeToLive=16

# EHCache configuration. See: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
# kernel.ehcache.peerListenerFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheManagerPeerListenerFactory
kernel.ehcache.peerListenerFactoryClass=

# EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.peerListenerFactoryProperties=port=40001,socketTimeoutMillis=500

# EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
# kernel.ehcache.cacheReplicatorFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheReplicatorFactory
# with ehcache-core 2.6.2
kernel.ehcache.cacheReplicatorFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.jgroups.JGroupsCacheReplicatorFactory

# EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.cacheReplicatorFactoryProperties=replicateAsynchronously=true,\
replicatePuts=true,\
replicateUpdates=true,\
replicateUpdatesViaCopy=true,\
replicateRemovals=true

replicateRemovals=true

# EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.destroyManagerWhenContextDie=true

# Cache region configuration
# by default we have two regions queryCacheRegion and entityCacheRegion
entityCacheRegion.size=50000

entityCacheRegion.evictionPolicy=LRU

entityCacheRegion.stats.enabled=true

entityCacheRegion.exclusiveComputation=false

# ttlSeconds - default ttl for entity cache records in the cache. If not set no TTL is set by default (entries are eternal)
entityCacheRegion.ttlSeconds=

queryCacheRegion.size=20000

queryCacheRegion.evictionPolicy=LRU

queryCacheRegion.stats.enabled=true

queryCacheRegion.exclusiveComputation=false

# ttlSeconds - default ttl for query cache records in the cache. If not set no TTL is set by default (entries are eternal)
queryCacheRegion.ttlSeconds=

# Default property to generate key with MD5
kernel.queryCache.createMD5=true

# Test properties only
# we do not have default-test.properties file pattern so they have to be here
regioncache.exclusivecomputation=true

regioncache.stats.enabled=true

regioncache.entityregion.size=10000

regioncache.entityregion.evictionpolicy=FIFO

regioncache.typesystemregion.size=10000

regioncache.typesystemregion.evictionpolicy=FIFO

regioncache.querycacheregion.size=10000

regioncache.querycacheregion.evictionpolicy=FIFO

# live data name for distributed counter
kernel.cache.liveDataCounterName=cacheDistributedCounter

# Enables generational cache for queries. It introduces overhead because each managed
# object modification has to be propagated to all cluster nodes
kernel.cache.generationalCacheEnabled=false

Properties of kernel-service

##################### Service ##################################################
#
# Enables/disables automatic flush invocation before query (true/false)
#
# @highlight
kernel.flushBeforeQuery=true

# enable/disable the query cache for metadata service
kernel.metadata.query.cache.enabled=false

# default time to live for query cache in msec
kernel.metadata.query.cache.ttl=0

# Name of bean which provides default SequenceService implementation
kernel.sequence.provider=jdbcPersistenceEngine

# Size of sequence cached numbers
kernel.sequence.cacheSize=500

# Number of attempts to get new number from sequence
kernel.sequence.maxAttempts=10

# Transaction number counter fixed size
kernel.transaction.counterSize=5000

Properties of hybris-commons-rest-client

#
# Base URI of the gateway, usually something like http://myHost:myPort/gateway-servlet/gateway
#
# @highlight
hybris.gateway.uri=http://myHost:myPort/gateway-servlet/gateway

#
# Sets whether an alternative endpointProvider then the ExternalEndpointProvider (gateway) should be used.
# For being able to use this property you must configure the AlternativeEndpointProviderFactory in your spring setup.
# It is recommended to use it only if you will use the gateway on production but wants to avoid the gateway usage in developent!
#
hybris.rest.client.alternative=true

#
# Allow to use a proxy setup for the rest client.
# Possible values:
# * 'auto' (default) proxy settings will be discovered based on system properties (http.proxyHost, http.proxyPort ...)
# * 'none' - no proxy will be set
# * a specific uri - this proxy will be used explicitly. example http://www.proxy.com:3128
#
hybris.rest.client.proxy=auto

#
# Connect timeout interval in milliseconds.
# A value of 0 is equivalent to an interval of infinity.
#
# @highlight
hybris.rest.client.httpclient.readTimeout=5000

#
# Sets the maximum number of connections allowed for the rest client.
#
hybris.rest.client.httpclient.connectionManager.maxConnectionsPerHost= 20

#
# The maximum number of connections allowed.
#
hybris.rest.client.httpclient.connectionManager.maxTotalConnections= 60

#
# The timeout in milliseconds used when retrieving an
# HTTP connection from the HTTP connection manager.
#
hybris.rest.client.httpclient.connectionManager.timeout= 5000

#
# Enables the logging of each request/response done by the rest client.
# It will log url, headers and message body
#
# @highlight
hybris.rest.client.logging.enabled=false

#
# Tells the rest client as which service the client should act.
# Used only in external endpoint scenario with usage of gateway.
# The rest client will use the current service configuration to build the request URL,
# the gateway will extract it from the URL and will use it to lookup the related subscription configuration.
# Possible values are all service id's having a service descriptor
#
# @highlight
hybris.current.service=myService

#
# Enables/Disables security for rest calls.
#
# @highlight
hybris.security.api.authentication.enable=false

#
# Enables/Disables basic authentication for rest calls.
#
# @highlight
hybris.security.http.basic.auth.enable=false

#
# The basic authentication username
#
hybris.security.http.basic.auth.username=

#
# The basic authentication password
#
hybris.security.http.basic.auth.password=

Properties of hybris-commons-security

#
# Implementation to use for apikeyprovider.
# Must be a spring bean name implementing ApiKeyProvider interface
#
hybris.security.apiKeyProvider=defaultApiKeyProvider

#
# Absolute path to key store file which is storing api keys
# for request authentication
#
# @highlight
hybris.security.keystore.path=/hybris/gateway.jks

#
# Password for key store in clear text
#
# @highlight
hybris.security.keystore.password=123456

#
# Defines the loading interval of key store file.
# For each get key request it will load keys from key store file
# only if last time file initialization is longer then given
# interval.
#
hybris.security.keystoreservice.loadIntervalInMs=1000

#
# Time out on the wait if key store file is locked.
# Based on given value in milli seconds it will try out to lock
# the key store file in given timeout.
#
hybris.security.fileLock.lockTimeOutInMs=10000

#
# Wait time in milli seconds till next try to lock the key store file.
#
hybris.security.fileLock.waitInMs=100
